tweets.text: I’m still in shock at the levels we’ve been subjected to. And that wasn’t the worst week...the worst was where they forgot to turn the monitor on! @EnvAgency @AaronBell4NUL @StinkStopthe https://t.co/DzgfHQUHse

In partnership with @syptweet, @SheffCouncil, @EnvAgencyYNE, firefighters have been working hard overnight to bring the fire on #CarlisleStreet under control.

There are now four fire crews at the scene along with a High Volume Pump and are expected to remain there for sometime. https://t.co/IuSEEjBAgC

tweets.text: #Water firms discharged raw #sewage into rivers and coastal waters in England more than 400,000 times last yr, says @EnvAgency.  How did they manage to get away with this behaviour  so long? Is it the need to keep bills down? @AnglingTrust @angling_times @CraigBennett3
@MissyDoom @EnvAgencyMids @NewsNBC @StinkStopthe @AaronBell4NUL Had to close bedroom window last night around 11.00pm. Rancid. Have given up reporting on ach incidence now. Nothing changes.

'We understand people's concerns' - @StaffordshireCC Director of Care and Health speaks about odours in west Newcastle and further afield   https://t.co/GLJNln8sQm  @EnvAgencyMids @NewsNBC @PHE_WestMids https://t.co/OZBQMhEJM1

@SianieRoo @BorisJohnson @EnvAgency @StinkStopthe With that toxic mix probably be cholera outbreak fairly soon. @BorisJohnson you said you would sort it, now is time to do just that #capitoff #stopthestink #WalleysQuarry

tweets.text: @1970Jdk @StinkStopthe @MissyDoom @EnvAgencyMids @NewsNBC @AaronBell4NUL Please don’t stop reporting it to the EA 🙏🏽 I know it’s a pain but it will hold value and make a change trust in that

@StinkStopthe @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgencyMids @JamesBevanEA @EnvAgency @RedIndustries2 Day after day, after day, night after night - @NewsNBC are living the groundhog stink day...How many more complaints do the @EnvAgency are needed? It’s woke my family up again... This is a health crisis, time for the Secretary of State for the environment to act  #stopthestink https://t.co/vmK1dPZmpF

#GoodFriday #Fish fantastic video of #BrookLamprey spawning
Filmed by #Herefordshire farmer Tony Norman a leading ambassador for the protection and improvement of our rivers in the #Wye catchment. 
#SpawningWatch 
@WUFoundation @theriverstrust @RiverFishUk @EnvAgencyMids https://t.co/0jtpX2nKyd

@GrahamH_Staffs @StinkStopthe @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgencyMids @JamesBevanEA @EnvAgency @RedIndustries2 I'm coming around to this idea. It's never been about compensation, however something needs to sort this quickly. Figures wise it should be calculated on the lost value of property and individual harms caused to health and wellbeing since the issue was first reported.

@DurhamCoast @1Easterbrook @DurhamCouncil @SunderlandUK @NaturalEngland @durhamwt @HeritageFundNOR @nationaltrust @NorthumbrianH2O @EnvAgencyYNE @GWKNE @HpoolCouncil @CoastalCA @LGACoastalSIG This sounds like something we can help with!
@StinkStopthe @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgencyMids @JamesBevanEA @EnvAgency @RedIndustries2 Class action lawsuit for 20,000 homes at £10,000 each would stop it.

Another night when thousands of houses get gassed @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgencyMids @JamesBevanEA @EnvAgency What punishment should @RedIndustries2  have for gassing a community? This can't be allowed to continue.

Statement from @StaffordshireCC Director of Care and Health on implications of odours in west Newcastle and further afield.  https://t.co/GLJNln8sQm  @EnvAgencyMids @NewsNBC @PHE_WestMids https://t.co/jjil0Zeulc

tweets.text: So @EnvAgencyMids it took a whopping 13 days of monitoring to discover the WHO 24hr H2S limit is being breached and exceeded by a full 3rd by the gas from #WalleysQuarry. When do we get to see the rest of the data? How often is it breaching the "annoyance" limit? @StinkStopthe
Local people have a right to be angry. @AaronBell4NUL we have faced months if not years of deflection tactics by the EA. ‘It must be the smell of rubber burning in Stoke..’ https://t.co/RS5feXuzC4

@AaronBell4NUL @PHE_uk I think it's important that we know what the peak levels are and how frequently. The gas gets trapped inside people's homes. It is plausibly at much higher levels than the outside averages for long periods of time.

@EnvAgency 25 years old, what a legacy.

“England’s rivers have become nothing more than an extension of the sewage system, polluted, poisoned and exploited for profit." https://t.co/NYtYA46c3g

Bearing in mind that the 30-minute peak in the previous monitoring exercise was 44.5, it’s clear my constituents are being subjected to a major and ongoing environmental incident.

I trust the culprits will be properly held accountable by @EnvAgencyMids.

@AaronBell4NUL @MissyDoom @EnvAgencyMids @AaronBell4NUL , I am truly aghast. I was certain that the odour nuisance guideline would be exceeded, but to hear that the health-based guidance is exceeded is truly astonishing. To think the residents of Newcastle were vilified for daring to complain, yet science backs them.

There is something missing from all the quotes from @DefraGovUK  and the @EnvAgency on sewage discharges today, when it comes to the @RiverChess these recent events are in breach of the water companies temporary permit to discharge untreated sewage.
https://t.co/l2QBu8FSLi

Worsening respiratory symptoms wasn’t https://t.co/HjabZO1L3A asthma became worse to the point I’m now back on regular inhalers.Interestingly when we get a reprieve from the gas my asthma improves after a few days.Whats your position on asthmatics @PHE_EoEngland ? https://t.co/fKluvnMknv

tweets.text: @StaffordshireCC @EnvAgencyMids @NewsNBC @PHE_WestMids After reading this I am ashamed to have paid my council tax today. I live 2 miles from the landfill. To tell me to close my windows and wait for the odour to clear before opening them again is an insult. This  odour enters my home as I sleep at night, windows & doors shut.

@StaffordshireCC @EnvAgencyMids @NewsNBC @PHE_WestMids Let's just say that if somebody was piping hydrogen sulphide into your offices and homes every day, you wouldn't be playing it down in this way. You'd do something.

Can’t quite believe it but the @EnvAgency is 25 today! I was there at the start joining as an Assistant Hydrologist. So much has changed (albeit not my taste in shirts) but probably most dramatically and positively the public’s awareness of the environment & climate.  #ea25years https://t.co/3bxEiEVxZV

tweets.text: This crow knows that humans have lost the sense of shame https://t.co/9ULY7qH4T2

@DurhamCoast @DurhamCouncil @SunderlandUK @NaturalEngland @durhamwt @HeritageFundNOR @nationaltrust @NorthumbrianH2O @EnvAgencyYNE @GWKNE @HpoolCouncil @CoastalCA @LGACoastalSIG An amazing transformation. I remember the 'black sand' when I first moved to the region.  It was a total shock after the 'golden sand' of the Kent Coast.  Now Durham and Sunderland's beaches can hold their own with some of the best in the country.  Congrats to all involved. https://t.co/w9SFRJXXGd

The 1st picture was taken on 16October2019 along the #SilkStream next to the bridge where the stream  enters #SilkstreamPark The litter was reported back then&many times since, but comparing it with the 2nd picture,taken last Sunday,it has still not been cleared,why?@EnvAgencySE https://t.co/RIvTug4ksY

@johncurtinEA Good to see you RT’ing @Feargal_Sharkey’s tweet on the terrible state of our rivers! So I do hope we’ll get your support as we begin working on a tiny stream #DollisBrook, a feeder of #WelshHarp and tributary of #RiverBrent. Happy 25th!

Looks like the @EnvAgency and @DefraGovUK missed a trick when they issued the latest data on sewage discharges today. If they had waited 24 hrs the public would have thought it was a joke. Surely the UK would not permit untreated sewage to be discharged into seas and rivers.

Sent a request to the @EnvAgency for the 2020 sewage discharge data for the individual sites, specifically Chesham STW. They are not the most responsive, especially when it might be embarrassing. The @EnvAgency and @DefraGovUK failed to point out many are a breach of permit.

tweets.text: With support from @cardiffuni @WUFoundation & @EnvAgency we’re designing a citizen science project to monitor water quality (including phosphate levels) on the Upper Wye. Let’s use people power to fill the data gap! https://t.co/nvtTcyuCBR https://t.co/LdLe6VQIbH

The Friends of the Upper Wye are now designing a citizen science programme to monitor water quality with help from Cardiff University, the Environment Agency and the Wye and Usk Foundation. https://t.co/mXBpQVShvp @FriendsUpperWye @EnvAgency @cardiffuni @WUFoundation #LDReporter

urls.description: WATER – Facts YOU Need to Know About Primary Water . . . The practice of accessing primary water has been around for centuries. What early Greek philosophers like Aristotle and the Italian Leonardo DaVinci believed, and enlightened scientists working at well-known universities today are exploring, is that all water is created in the mantle of the earth and is available in limitless quantities, worldwide. Drilling for primary water looks similar to drilling for ground water. The main difference in accessing
